title: Steve Kerr will miss Warriors opener, first road trip
text:
So much for the Golden State Warriors taking the so-called easy road again. Their title defense is off to a tough start.
GM Bob Myers announces that Luke Walton will coach Tuesday night opener. Kerr improving but not ready to return #Warriors
— Ron Kroichick (@ronkroichick) October 24, 2015 General manager Bob Myers announced to reporters at his team’s practice on Saturday that head coach Steve Kerr would miss the regular season opener Tuesday night against the New Orleans Pelicans and will likely miss the ensuing road trip as well. Kerr has been away from the team since early October, when it was announced that his offseason back surgeries caused the kinds of complications that demanded more rest.
Assistant coach Luke Walton will continue to take Kerr’s place for the Warriors, who enjoyed so much health and prosperity en route to their championship last June during Kerr’s first season. Golden State, which routed the Los Angeles Lakers 136-97 on Thursday, went 3-4 in the preseason while he was away.
Kerr likely to miss first road trip, too
— Ron Kroichick (@ronkroichick) October 24, 2015 The Warriors’ opener against the Pelicans at Oracle Arena will come with a touch of coincidence, as former Golden State associate head coach Alvin Gentry took the job in New Orleans during the summer but would have been in Walton’s position now had he not left. After facing New Orleans, the Warriors play at the Houston Rockets and New Orleans on Oct. 30 and Oct. 31, respectively, before returning home on Nov. 2 to host the Memphis Grizzlies.
